item.title: [DISTRELEC-7104] DE // Adding a Shipping or a billing address
item.description:
Hi Rafael,
in the shipping address newly the name and the surname are mandatory fields.
That causes to problems with the delivery.
Please change this and make name and surname to a optional field.
Thank you!!
item.summary: DE // Adding a Shipping or a billing address

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Please test after the next deployment.

Hi Ruben, i have test it in Q now, what about the marked field in the screenshot? Can you also change that one to an optional field. In language German it makes no sense to have that as a mandatory field, it is more confusing,
When you also can make this i will close the ticket afterwards

fields are mandatory in P, after deployment

http://jira.distrelec.com/secure/attachment/18900/2015-07-08%2000_49_37-Distrelec%20Schuricht%20Germany.png
Please clean your cache. I don't see any issue (attachment)

See 1 Screenshot "GERMAN VERSION 1"
THE PART TITLE MAKES NO SENSE AS A MANDATORY FIELD!
Maybe the fields First and Last name seem like they are not mandatory but as you can see in the screenshot they are mandatory, also after the deployment!
See 2 Screenshot "ENGLISH VERSION 1"
SAME AS GERMAN VERSION, IT MAKES NO SENSE!
See 3 Screenshot "ENGLISH VERSION"
Maybe the fields First and Lastname seem like they are not mandatory but as you can see in the screenshot they are mandatory, also after the deployment!

So again: THE CONSEQUENCE OF THIS ISSUE IS FOR US ANGRY CUSTOMERS!!!! PLease proceed this asap!

Hi Surendra,

please review the service "/createUpdate/b2b/shipping"

For DE, the fields "title", "firstName", and "lastName" must NOT be mandatory.

Come back to me for any question.
Thanks
Evangelos Kontopoulos | Lodestone plz look at the attachment.

Hello Surendra,
This was a bug and we have fix it now. Please check again and note that when this change goes to production we need also to move our change there.

Hi Rafi.
Please check if the fix version is ok,

Zisan Merter | Distrelec: Please test after the next deployment
Works now in Q.
OK IN Q

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7253] Missing option "Register with an existing customer number"
item.description:
According to the requirements and scope of the export shop. It should be possible like for the other ELFA shops to create a user account based on an already existing customer ID. However the third option misses in the export shop.

  • Please add the option and assure the correct function of creation an user account on a already existing customer number (B2B account).
  • It should only be possible for B2B customer. So the possibility to choose "B2C" in the register form should be disabled.

---------------------------------

I am doing the test scenario 1 (Creation of B2B customer).
Step 6: i can not create a new Contact person (where is this option?) and also i could not find where to create a sub-user

Reporter: Thibaud Rassat
E-mail: thibaud.rassat@elfa.se
item.environment:
*Location*: http://test.distrelec.biz/
*User-Agent*: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64; Trident/7.0; .NET4.0E; .NET4.0C; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; InfoPath.3; rv:11.0) like Gecko
*Screen Resolution*: 1067 x 640
item.summary: Missing option "Register with an existing customer number"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please assign to the correct sprint and developer since I am not sure if this still fits in the current sprint, or not.
Please review.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7250] Additional DB index to optimize access for PriceRow
item.description:
Analyzing the JDBC log I found some slow queries accessing PriceRow table.

This is an example SQL that I optimized:

SELECT item_t0.PK
FROM pricerows item_t0
WHERE ( item_t0.p_productmatchqualifier IN ( 0 ,8802101067777 )
AND item_t0.p_usermatchqualifier        IN ( 0 ,8796093087748 ,8796131459163 ))
AND (item_t0.TypePkString               IN (8796129067090,8796101214290)
AND ((( item_t0.p_product               IS NOT NULL
OR item_t0.p_catalogversion             IS NULL
OR item_t0.p_catalogversion             IN (8796093219417,8796093186649,8796191392345,8796093153881) ))) )

Additional index DDL:

CREATE INDEX TEMP_BY_ADI_1 ON PRICEROWS
(P_PRODUCTMATCHQUALIFIER,
P_USERMATCHQUALIFIER,
P_PRODUCT,
P_CATALOGVERSION,
TYPEPKSTRING,
PK);

And here is the before/after compare (20 samples):

  • execution time before: 18...487 ms
  • execution time after: 1...7 ms
***** BEFORE ADDING THE INDEX *****
116359|master|150715-15:47:55:646|187 ms|statement|SELECT  item_t0.PK  FROM pricerows item_t0 WHERE ( item_t0.p_productmatchqualifier  IN ( ? ,? ) AND  item_t0.p_usermatchqualifier  IN ( ? ,? ,? )) AND (item_t0.TypePkString IN  (?,?)  AND (((   item_t0.p_product  IS NOT NULL OR item_t0.p_catalogversion  IS NULL OR  item_t0.p_catalogversion  IN (?,?,?,?) ))) )|SELECT  item_t0.PK  FROM pricerows item_t0 WHERE ( item_t0.p_productmatchqualifier  IN ( 0 ,8796971532289 ) AND  item_t0.p_usermatchqualifier  IN ( 0 ,8796093087748 ,8797338239067 )) AND (item_t0.TypePkString IN  (8796129067090,8796101214290)  AND (((   item_t0.p_product  IS NOT NULL OR item_t0.p_catalogversion  IS NULL OR  item_t0.p_catalogversion  IN (8796093219417,8796093186649,8796224356953,8796093153881) ))) )

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7232] disable DistLoggingOutInterceptor log when logging not activated
item.description:
Avoid to log not useful information such as:
[DistLoggingOutInterceptor] SOAP CALL NOT LOGGED: .....
item.summary: disable DistLoggingOutInterceptor log when logging not activated

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7230] test.distrelec.ee new b2b customer registration ...
item.description:
test.distrelec.ee
new b2b customer registration
Field KMKR should be not mantadory

Reporter: Igor Pudov
E-mail: igor.pudov@elfa.se

------------------------------------------
Same as in the German web shop the VAT ID (in esti "KMKR") input field must not be mandatory. (See screenshot)
https://test.distrelec.ee/register/b2b

*User-Agent*: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/43.0.2357.132 Safari/537.36
*Screen Resolution*: 1680 x 1050
item.summary: test.distrelec.ee new b2b customer registration ...

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: First bug for the next sprint. Make sure it's going to get an estimation before the next sprints starts as René requested.
Please review

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7193] LT Q // VAT field should be Length 11 or 14 LT123456789 or LT123456789123
item.description: please change accordingly
item.summary: LT Q // VAT field should be Length 11 or 14 LT123456789 or LT123456789123

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I updated the VAT ID validation pattern on the Q nodes. I made the changes also in the base_lt.properties for next deployments. The translations are also up to date.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7148] SAP Interfaces - Display error messages in full
item.description:
as agreed with Rene, let us display full error messages from the interfaces.

On the registration please display the SAP error message to the customer.
item.summary: SAP Interfaces - Display error messages in full

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Hello Oana,
As we discussed SAP currently is returning a text with the description of the SAP message. Somehow this needs to be handled from the Webshop team.

@Evangelos

I double checked with Dean a file from production system. We found some strange values like 77, 153, 201, etc.

We cross-checked with the ELFA webshop, and most of them have a different values.

On most products the field is empty: What is the default value, what should be displayed on the web shop? "1"? (there are products with the field value 1 though)
Thank you for clarifying Evangelos.
Hello Dean to which field ar referred to and can I have an example?

Hi Evangelos,

Field: "Original pack size", which should be the same as "Sales_Package" (maybe that is not correct?)
The values within the file we receive from SAP are strange.

  • The most products have a empty "original pack size". Which leads us to the question, what value should be displayed if no original pack size is specified. An assumption: We can display 1. Is this correct?
    Examples for products with empty "original pack size within the file"
    ELFA Nr. 1030335 (in the file empty, in elfa.se "500")
    ELFA Nr. 1053785 (in the file empty, in elfa.se "1")
  • Other products have a value, but not the same as displayed on the ELFA shop.
    Example from Nabil: ELFA Nr.: 1026274, in the file we have 77, and on elfa webshop it is 1.

I attached the file we got and referring to .

Hi all,

after deep investigation, I found the following:

  • The "Sales_Package" in the file does not represent the amount of pieces in the packet but it represents the "code" of the "DistSalesUnit" linked to the product.
  • The "DistSalesUnit"s are predefined in Hybris and contains the amount of pieces in the packet.
  • From the Interface point of view (IF01) nothing needs to be changed.
  • Some products do not have a "DistSalesUnit", which explain the empty field in the file.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-7028] Suggestion layer - tracking
item.description:
The tracking of the suggestion layer is only implemented via Webtrek for the product suggestion, but there is no tracking implemented for the category suggestions, manufacture suggestions nor the search suggestions.

It seems a Fact Finder standard feature to be able to track the suggestion layer, as can be read on the pdf:

"In order to track how many users actually use the suggestion produced by the Suggest module, and therefore automatically help to optimise the suggestions, you must integrate a tracking solution. The necessary tracking parameters are already contained within the returned Search parameters URL. Therefore, normally only this URL needs to be used and the parameters simply have to be passed through.
If you are unable or do not want to use the supplied search parameters URL, you must add the tracking parameters to the search calls yourself.
You can inspect the log file analysis to determine how many search queries are generated by the Suggest module. To do this you need to ensure that such search queries are supplied with the parameter queryFromSuggest=true.
If you want to track what terms are suggested for what inputs, you also need to pass the original term entered by the user as the value for the parameter userInput. For example, if many users select “Paracetamol” from the list after typing “pa” then this entry will be ranked higher and will appear further up in the list."

As a practical example, you can check the conrad website, links after clicking on the suggest layer are like this:
http://www.conrad.biz/ce/de/brand/trendwerk77?queryFromSuggest=true

Please implement the Fact Finder standard tracking, accordingly.

Thank you,
Laura

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6987] SEO/UX - Fluctuation Issues - product with stock and EOL replacement to Display
item.description:
Observations :

  • DISTRELEC-6526 have been deployed without final validation on Q.
  • By testing on P, incorrect behavior have been discovered :
    • Products with stock and EOL replacement inside search/category results redirect to their their upper available node folowing the rules defined by DISTRELEC-6526.
    • On certain case the redirected landing page change the clickable behavior of the product displayed as results, exemple :
      • 500 error on every products for a search of 102997
      • infinite redirection on the upper category node for the search of the id :
        • 100335
        • 14021833
        • 600323

Impact :

  • SEM : Google Shopping is detecting the faulty redirection, we have until the 10/07/15 to correct it or they will cut the entire advertising (-30% of SEM traffic).
  • UX : The user is lost if he interact with this bugged functionality.
  • UX : Once a visitor have encountered this navigational bug, his navigation path is blocked, major increase of bounce rate to expect.
  • SEO/SEM : Correct landing pages are redirected to a non relevant/functionnal page.
  • This behavior is happening for XX% of the products. (XX tbd)
  • XX% are not accessible on Hybris. (XX tbd)

Demands :

  • When a 0 stock product become EOL and :
    • we don't have a correct replacement product => Redirect in 301 to their upper category level url, (if there is no category available redirect to the homepage, same logic as implemented on DISTRELEC-5960).
      Exemple (if this product is EOL) : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/16924407 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../c/cat-186834
    • we have a replacement for the product => Redirect in 301 to the replacement product url.
      Exemple (if this product is EOL) : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/16924407 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/.../p/new_productid_replacing_EOL
  • Inform the user :
    • if redirection on category page, display a popin showing this message :
      "Unfortunately, the product you are looking for is end of life. We show you products from the same category."
    • if redirection on the home page, display a discrete popin showing this message :
      "Unfortunately, the product you are looking for is end of life and won't be replaced. We have redirected you to the homepage."
    • if redirection on product page, display a popin showing this message :
      "Unfortunately, the product you are looking for is end of life. We show you the replacement product."
    • if we have a replacement for the product but the product still have stock, display a popin on the product page showing this message :
      "The product you are looking for is end of life. The product XXX id NNN is the replacement."

=> In Blue, new requirement from the UX side.
=> In Black, the requirement already implemented with DISTRELEC-6526.

Checking process :

  • This issue cannot be deployed on P without a check on dev/Q and a written confirmation of PHUBERT in the comment below.
  • This issue cannot be closed without final live check on P.
  • Update the status of the deployment on dev/Q/P in the comment below.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6654] ELFA - Productdetailpage additional attributes
item.description:
Specification and open questions:
http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/C51-ProductInformation

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Origin requirements

At the moment the following fields are shown on the old ELFA-shop:

  • Distrelec Article number: Movex MARA-ZZCHD_MATNR: Included
  • Manufacture article number (Type?): Manufacture article number : MARA- MFRPN : Comes from PIM (To be checked)
  • Manufacturer name: MARA- MFRNR that is the code > can read LFA1-NAME : Comes from PIM
  • Country of origin: which plant ? MARC-HERKL : Included
  • Original pack size I would say ZZPACK_CODE and then ZDGTT_PACK_CODE-QUANTITY and –unit : Included
  • Our sales pack size: we do NOT have a sales unit different to the field before : N/A
  • Dimensions (incl. package): MARA-LAENG, -breit, -hoehe in MARA-MEABM: Will come from PIM
  • Weight (incl. package): MARA-BRGEW in MARA-GEWEI: This will come (or is coming) from PIM
  • Customs number: Tariff code ? Which plant MARC-STAWN : To be investigated if PIM or SAP should provide this data
  • UNSPSC (in PIM): Is already in PIM
  • RoHs complience (in PIM): MARA-ZZROHS_INFO: included already both in SAP and PIM

In the new shop we actually only show the following product fields:

  • Distrelec Article number
  • Manufacture article number
  • Manufacturer name
  • Our sales pack size

Next steps

  1. Investigate which attributes come from PIM and which come from ERP.
  2. Investigate the impact of adding them to the exports. (New full imports needed?)
  3. Clarify if this change applies only to the export-shop, only to ELFA or even to all countries: Applies to ELFA
  4. Start development if above investigations are done.

Requirement | Verified:
Implementation of the following additional attributes to be shown on the product detail page.

  • Country of origin | from ERP
  • Original pack size | ERP
  • Dimensions (incl. package) | ERP
  • Weight (incl. package) | ERP
  • Customs number | ERP
  • UNSPSC | from PIM
  • RoHs complience | from PIM

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6644] Remove "SAP ghosts" and Deleted products from FF feed
item.description:
As mentioned before, we have articles in the FF feed, which are not intended to be in the shop (e.g. opened products in SAP but not yet ok to web from PIM or deleted articles in PIM, which still seem to be active in the shop). This on the one hand blows up the file size of the search feed and as I don't know if there is any cleansing/update process in place, I just assume that this number is steadily growing (we are currently on 17660 - see attachment). On the other hand - and more important - some of these products still appear with stock and therefore are shown as recommendations in the worst case.

This is why they have to be excluded from the feed. Please introduce a logic that excludes all these products from the FF-feeds.

The products can be recognised by the ProductURL containing /----/p/ --> adjustment from 29.06.15: they are not available like this in the feed anymore; now it's //p/
All the other (non-ERP) fields are empty --> probably/hopefully you have a better recognition possibility to reliably remove them from the feed.

e.g. on the shop:
http://www.distrelec.ch/de/----/p/16901617?mainId=30008090 --> being a recommendation of 30008090
item.summary: Remove "SAP ghosts" and Deleted products from FF feed

@René:

It might be the case that a product was added during the days when Movex was master for IF-01. Such a product may never have existed in NewSAP. As a result there are no SalesOrgProduct info.

SalesOrgProduct contains a SalesStatus which decide visibility in shop. See http://wiki.distrelec.com/display/distrelint/ERP+Codelist+-+DistSalesStatus.
All visible products currently are exported to FF.

I guess we need to keep the eol-Products in FF for the case:

  • the customer enters an eol article number into the direct order
  • the customer enters an eol article number into the search field

But we need to make sure the the filter to remove eol product from the category lists (implemented on factfinder from omikron) works correctly.

If they have to stay in the feed, it has to be made sure that all the product data apart from the product number is not exported to the feed anymore and that all of them are really marked as EOL products. Otherwise, we can have issues with the reco engine and the suggest function.

According to Raphael the EOL products are only filtered from the navigation but not from the search, suggest and direct order.

What should happen when a customer types an EOL product to the search field
and what if he types the EOL product into the direct order?

Maybe we can add a customisation to FF to not use EOL product for recommendations.

The problem: Product exist in Movex but not in SAP should not be a problem,
because every product has it own sales-status in every country and if there is not sales-status for a country the product is not exported to FF.

deleted articles in PIM, which still seem to be active in the shop

Can you please explain, why products are deleted in PIM, and how we are able to recognise them in the export?

The process is that product management deletes products from PIM when they are EOL. If we have some new examples we could check what Status is taken into account as Movex might be updated later than SAP (or vice versa), depending on the ran procedure.

If those are really active products in every ERP, then we Need to check how many they are, and who does that because it's not allowed.

Do you have recent examples?

/Daniela

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6548] SEO - Duplication Issues - Category level with only one product
item.description:
Observations :

  • This category contain only one product : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/c/cat-671902
  • This case happen in 26% of the categories (10k per lang, so 30k for ch) (verified by a crawl, sample),
  • A category is supposed to contain multiple products,
  • The products inside a category can fluctuate and create a "1 product category",
  • A category can be created with only one product by category managers,

Impacts :

  • UX side, it's a useless step for a user browsing the website.
  • SEO side, this create a huge amount of duplicated categories, which is killing the entire process of indexation and ranking.

Demands :

  • Redirect in 301 categories with only one product inside to this product (same process as the search results with only one results).
    Example : http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/c/cat-671902 =301> http://www.distrelec.ch/en/*/p/30011702
  • If this functionality create a blocking issue for the UX side, implement it only for robots.

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4593] SEO - Duplications Issues - Between Manufacturer - 301 to add and db to clean
item.description:
Observations :

  • On http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/, several manufacturers seems duplicated :
  • CRITICAL UPDATE 27/07/14 : On http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux product contents have disappeared and "Manufacturer not found" message appear.

Impacts :

  • SEO :
    • This bug create pure DUST (Different URLs, Similar Text) duplicate.
    • That lead into duplication of content, waste of crawl and finally not be ranked properly inside the search engine result pages.
  • CRITICAL UPDATE 27/07/14 : SEM/Emailing/Marketing :
    • All campaign that target manufacturer landing page lead to empty landing pages

Demands :

  • Removal of the wrong anchor and links on http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/ : OK
  • For tracking purpose, the tracking suffix shouldn’t get lost during the redirections : NOK
  • EDIT : 05/08/14 : SAP manufacturer id force us to make a compromise on the manufacturer url behavior,
    we will have to redirect in http 301 all cropped manufacturer name url and their one original url to this pattern "http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/full_brand_name/sap_cropped_brand_name
    • Exemple :
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul :NOK
      • http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/aul -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux/aul : OK
  • EDIT 28/08/14 : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer to fix : OK

Checking process :

  • Need to be verify locally by PHUBERT
  • This issue can't be closed without my final live check.
  • Thank you to update the status of the implementation in the comment below.
item.summary: SEO - Duplications Issues - Between Manufacturer - 301 to add and db to clean

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Live check :

=> Reopening of the issue

Live check 28/07/14 :
- Removal of the wrong anchor and links : NOK, still wrong links on the page
- 301 redirect of the wrong manufacturer : NOK

New evolution, all the good url (exemple http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux) are now providing an error "Manufacturer not found" and no content on the page.
As requested previously, we must keep the full naming structure for the manufacturer and redirect in http 301 the cropped named pages to the full named once.
Product content must appear on the full named manufacturer pages ASAP !

These are the manufacturers that are listed in the footer, but not available in the system:

===Start statistic of manufacturers===
Manufacturers listed in manufacturer page [1347]

Manufacturer [ban_boehler] does not exist.
Manufacturer [sony] does not exist.
Manufacturer [amprobe] does not exist.
Manufacturer [brother] does not exist.
===End statistic of manufacturers===

I've created the ticket DISTRELEC-4688 to change the content of the footer.

On the current version I cannot find any duplicated manufacturer.
Manufacturer Accuride only occurs once (/manufacturer/acu)

The manufacturer have been deduplicated, but only the bad one have been kept :

We just need :
1 - The content back on the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
2 - The links to the /manufacturer/not-cropped-named on the /manufacturer/ page (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)
3 - 301 redirect from /manufacturer/cropped-named to /manufacturer/not-cropped-named (exemple : http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acc -301> http://www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/acculux)

Live check :
NOK
Florian, for this i need the list of the list of the mapping between the "old" manufacturer code and the new one.
https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-4689

Here the description of the solution.

The old PIM manufacturer code is now deprecated (eg: for Bosch the manufacturer code was bosch)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch
The new SAP manufacturer code is now used (eg: for Bosh the new manufacturer code is bsh)
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh

To make the maufacturer url SEO compliant we will add the manufacturer name to the url in that way: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/[manufacturer-name]/[manufacturer-code]
For Bosch the manufacturer url will look like this:
www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
This URL will be exposed everywhere in the webshop as new canonical URL, in this way will be crawled.

Here the note about redirects:

  • OLD url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This is useful because the search engines still have the old urls
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch ----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
  • NEW url will be redirected to the new CANONICAL url
    This because internally the webshop will refer only to the new url
    Example: www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bsh----> www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh

@francesco : Thx, for the details.
For the rewritten url, it's highly preferable to avoid capital letter.
Capital letter inside url just lead to side effect and maintenance problems in SEO and linking.
Exemple :
Bad : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/BOSCH/bsh
Good : www.distrelec.ch/manufacturer/bosch/bsh

Implementation is done
What is missing is to finalize the apache redirects for old->new manufacturer codes.

Tell me when you need me to do the check on http://test.distrelec.ch

item.title: [DISTRELEC-6768] NPS (Net Promoter Score) Implementation
item.description:
On the order confirmation page (thank you note) we Need to have 3 new elements:

  • One introduction title regarding "How likely are you to recommend us to a colleague?"
  • Radio button with values from 0-10 (the NPS)
  • One free text
  • NPS Type: "Order Confirmation" (constant hidden value in the order confirmation page)

The values need to be stored somewhere in the DB and retrievable (auto-Generation of a Report).
Generation of the "Feedback" report must be generated DAILY and sent to email addresses provided by ALE.

This Report should contain:

  • Input Date (Mandatory), i.e. YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
  • NPS Type (Mandatory) i.e. Order, Delivery Deprecated
  • Domain (Mandatory) i.e. www.distrelec.ch, www.distrelec.de,...
  • Order number (Mandatory)
  • Customer number
  • Customer Name (Mandatory)
  • Customer email
  • Company Name
  • NPS (Mandatory)
  • Free text comment

Suggestion: Develop the Generation of a Report over a timeframe (definable, first Suggestion is one week) and a cron-job which runs on a weekly Basis.

Note:

  • The Formular (NPS dropbox and Free Text Comment, hidden NPS Type) needs to be reusable on a CMS/Merchandizing page. The Merchandizing page will have an other hidden NPS Type (e.g. "Delivery Confirmation"), that will require to retrieve additional variables from http request
  • This Report will feed Qlikview to create proper reporting (Definition still required).
  • For now Export always each ones in a flatfile (csv), ";" separator

If clarity in specification are required, come by to David.

Variables that come with the url:
https://www.distrelec.de/de/cms/nps?salesorg=7350&contactnum=326411&order=003UUL0A&cnumber=1202553&fname=Armin&namn=Freaking&email=zilling%40most-mobile.net&lang=de&company=MOST%20Mobile%20Specials%20GmbH&delivery=20150622

The url parameters should be passed (could happen that not all urls come with all parameters complete or even some missing)
